meta_data.title: Herod and the Magi
meta_data.subtitle: Thanks to everyone who supports TMBH at  You're the reason we can all do this together!  Opening song, "" from the album, "" by

transcription_data.text: Hello, my friends, it's Matt. This is the 10 Minute Bible Hour Podcast, and we're doing a special bonus week this week in Matthew chapter 2. This is, let me see, one, two, three. This is a fourth one out of five right now. So if you haven't got the previous three from this week, you might want to, or you can see it on the internet. You can do whatever you want. I mean, I'm not going to tell you what to do. What I will tell you is we got Nehemiah starting on Monday, New Year, New Season. I've been working on that this week. Real excited about it. Jeff made new music. It's so good. We made a Nehemiah song. Those little sounds and stuff, and they're all Nehemiah-ish. It's going to be awesome. And also, my lovely family is busting their butts, packing up mailings for everybody who sports the program in any way. At any level, on any platform, we got the Nehemiah Field Notes book going out. Those probably start shipping tomorrow, but they're almost all packaged up and ready to go to the post office. And then you get your Esther achievement unlocked sticker in there as well with the gold outline. So they just been to a lot of 10 minute Bible hours stuff lately. It's been real, real fun. But for now, here's the fourth part of this special bonus week on Matthew. Enjoy. He called together all the people's chief priests and teaches the law. This is Matthew indicating that everybody in religious leadership was complicit in this decision. And he asked them where Christ was to be born in Bethlehem in Judea. They replied. This is a reference to Micah 5-2. They quoted, but you Bethlehem and the land of Judah are by no means least among the rulers of Judah, for out of you will come a ruler who will be the shepherd of my people Israel. So everybody's clear on this. The religious leaders know it by heart. They didn't have to go and do a ton of research. They know this is where the Messiah is supposed to come from. And if anything, that just ups the tension level. So Herod cooks up a plan. Herod has already long since crossed over that moral threshold from, well, I wouldn't want anybody to get hurt to, I'll starve my mom to death if it helps me stay on my throne. If we just got to kill some babies in order for Herod to remain king, what are a few babies? This is a very expensive thing to become king as it was. It's going to double down on his investment. He calls the Magi secretly, found out from them the exact time the star appeared, which means now he knows how old the baby is, so he knows who to pursue. And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, go and make a careful search for the child as soon as you find him, report to me so I too, may go and worship him. And it seems like they must have bought it. They wouldn't know any of the insanity of Herod. They traveled to a really wealthy great kingdom, and the wealthy great king invited them to his palace. Whoa! You'd be a little star struck by that. What wonderful hospitality. And oh, well, of course he'd be into the same thing. I mean, this is a great thing for everybody. Cool. We have a pal here in this Herod guy, and they go on their way. And I believe they were convinced, and Herod believed he had convinced them because he sends no escort, no spy, nobody to make sure that he knows where they're going. He's confident this whole thing is going to go to plan. After they heard the king, they went on their way, and the star they'd seen in the east one ahead of them until it stopped over the place where the child was. Again, it doesn't sound like a supernova. When they saw the star, they were overjoyed. On coming to the house, they saw the child with his mother Mary, and they bowed down and worshiped him. That part of the passage really strikes me. Do we have any two-year-olds in the room? Isn't one-year-olds? Yeah, I see a few months old. I am so squishy for babies after having our own. I don't know. They seemed okay before, like a necessary aspect of humanity. We're going to need more of us later to do the work and keep the engines moving and the lights on. Yeah, that's great. And then you actually get one of those for yourself, and you're like, mercy, I like these things. And they like me back. And you even kind of, you just forget that you're elbow deep and poop. And you just, it's just, cost of doing business is fine. You forget the unbelievable amount of money that they cost to keep around, and you just like them. And yet as much as I am ridiculously squishy babies and little kids and everyone I see makes me think of my own, it has never occurred to me at any moment to fall flat on my face on the ground and worship them as I would a God. Ever. That's the most unnatural thing I could ever think of. But I think of when I see a kid, especially my own, or a little baby, is you have so much to learn. You got this mind that isn't all clouded up with all the dumb stuff that happens in the world yet. You're not broken down. You're not frustrated. You haven't utterly blown something yet, so you don't know that heartache and you will and you'll learn from it and it's okay. But there's this wonderful innocence, and I feel this impulse that I help. I want to make a little contribution. I want them to know, you're welcome in the world. And we love you and you got a whole bunch of grownups around here who will teach you and care about you but not worship. And that's what they do. They must have known something. In fact, I think that's part of what Matthew is driving at with the way he structures this whole passage. These guys arrived at this house to worship this two year old based on the testimony of a star and some ancient literature written in another language from a different people group. He used astrology to figure out where Jesus was. You know what the Old Testament condemns? Astrology. Nowhere in here is Matthew saying astrology is a good idea because look at work for those guys. No, his point is not astrology is cool now. His point is, look, if these guys who had no clue were completely wrong and arrived at this through incredibly dubious compromised means through a practice that was not looked fondly upon by the Jewish people and they got it and they knew that this was the king, the shepherd of Israel, the scepter, the star. This is the one who deserved true worship and they traveled all the way across Asia on foot to do it. What on earth was the matter with the religious leadership? They lived six miles from where the baby was born. They have the Bible. Their entire job and education is sit around and study a story that points exclusively to this moment. It's not like well they had other stuff to do and this is a weekend hobby. Their entire lives were about this thing. They were professional Messiah watchers and they just whiffed completely. At this point, I think you all know and remember and have heard plenty of times that once again we're not talking about baby Jesus at the manger when we talk about this scene. We're talking about the child Jesus who we think of as being from Nazareth, so why is he still in Bethlehem at this point? There are all kinds of perfectly reasonable theories as to how this young family moved around. We're going to see that they end up in Egypt for a while in the next passage and eventually they do land back in Nazareth but it would make sense that there would be an extended time here especially considering the circumstances of the birth. They bring these gifts. Gold incense, myrrh, I could take a bunch of time and break those down but let me just put it this way. One is gold, you've heard of it. One is frankincense. It has incense in the name so you can do the math on that and the other one is myrrh and there's a Christian record label from the 1980s called that so you can do the math on that one too. That actually isn't that helpful. The thing is from a sap and it's used for preparing the dead also for some more dubious perfume uses associated with other lines of work and the bottom line is these were just three really really really really really pricey things. Probably those really pricey things would have come in very handy in just a short period of time when Herod decides that he's going to kill all the babies and Mary and Joseph need to go to an expensive place on an expensive road trip as a young couple without a lot of money and without a job. So I'm assuming that those gifts probably paid for their flight to Egypt making them very providential. You'll hear from time to time people trying to cram an analogy into this. The gold is like a king and the frankincense is like for deity and I don't know maybe I'm just going to go with maybe and not stretch the analogy myself. Then something we're seeing a lot lately happens and having been warned in a dream not to go back to Herod they returned to their country by another route. We've seen for whatever reason God communicate oftentimes around this birth narrative part of the story through dreams and it happens here again and it must have been very compelling because these sane smart people choose to deny the orders of their likeable host king who's super rich and treated them super well because well they're risking life and limb in a foreign country to break the law and ignore the decree of a king to go another way.
